cult.name: House of Golden Bones

goal.entry: Undermine organisations and governments to gather influence and herold the rise of there master to godhood

cultists.entry: Nobles hungering for power, NPCs and creatures affiliated with fire

entries: TODO

entries.name: Heat of the Eternal Flame
entries: The creature gains resistance to fire damage and all its weapon attacks deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

object.name: Brimstone Cannon

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

entries: The brimstone cannon is a massive dragon head statue made of basalt carried by four fire giants. An attuned spellcaster can then fire a huge beam of fire energy from it. Before it can be fired, it must be aimed. It takes one action to aim and one action to fire it.

actionEntries.name: Blast Breath
entries: The cannon fires a 20-foot diameter beam of fire in a 200 feet line. Any creature in the area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 91 ({@damage 26d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This damage can not be reduced in any other way.

item.name: Amulet of Draconic Superiority
entries: While wearing this amulet, the minimum damage of your breath weapons and magic equals their average damage.

item.name: Skjaersilden
entries: Long ago, the dwarven blacksmith and high priest of Tharmekhûl Bork Loderr created the axe out of obsidian and adamantine to honor his patron deity. Tharmekhûl was pleased with the result and bestowed his blessing upon the axe and bork creating the artifact now known as Skjaersilden.

entries.name: Magic Weapon
entries: Skjaersilden is a magic weapon that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. The axe also functions as a {@item belt of dwarvenkind}, a {@item dwarven thrower} and a {@item sword of sharpness}.

entries.name: Benefical Properties
entries: While you are attuned to the axe, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain resistance to fire damage
You gain proficiency with smith's tools
Your weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage and an extra {@damage 1d6} radiant damage

entries.name: Detrimental Properties
entries: While you are attuned to the axe, you gain the following detrimentals:

items: You take {@damage 4d10} fire damage when you become attuned to the artifact.

You gain a horrible burn scar whereever the axe made contact with you while attuning, giving you disadvantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks and advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as {@spell heal} or {@spell regenerate} , remove the scar
An avatar of {@deity Tharmekhûl} will try to find you, in order to find out if you are worthy of the axe.

entries.name: Blessing of Tharmekhûl
entries: If you are a dwarf attuned to the axe and deemed worthy by Tharmekhûl, you gain the following benefits:

items: When you are hit with an attack that deals fire damage, you can give yourself immunity to fire damage until the start of your next turn. After you use this feature, roll {@dice 1d6}, on a roll of 1-4 you can't use this feature again until the next dawn.
Your {@sense darkvision} can see through magical darkness
The scar you got from attuning to the axe turns into a tribal tattoo, removing the disadvantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks you make
The bonus fire and radiant damage the axe deals increases to {@dice 1d10} each.

entries.name: Conjure Fire Elemental
entries: While you are holding the axe, you can use your action to cast the {@spell conjure elemental} spell from it, summoning a fire elemental. You can't use this property again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Arson
entries: When you first attune to the axe, you gain a permanent character flaw: "I have the compulsion to set the world on fire." You can remove this flaw by the means of a {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

entries.name: Destroying the Axe
entries: The only way to destroy the axe is to melt it down in the fiery depths below Abriymoch the central city of the fourth layer of the nine hells, Phlegethos. It must remain there for fifty years in order to break down completly.

item.name: Dress of Balder
entries: The Dress of Balder looks like an elegant black evening dress. Long ago, the bard balder the radiant created the dress for the actors of his theater in order to potray female rolls.

entries.name: Magic Item
entries: The dress functions as a {@item hat of disguise}.

entries.name: Dashing Presense
entries: While attuned to the dress and wearing it, your AC is equal to 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Charming Nature
entries: While wearing the dress, you have advantage on charisma ({@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Deception}) checks made to influence a person of a different gender than you.

legendaryGroup.name: Baldur
regionalEffects: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Baldur can take the following regional action:

items.name: Grasp of the Abomination
entries: Squirming, ebony tentacles and bear claws fill a 10-foot square on ground that Baldur can see within 60 feet of him. Until Initiative count 20 on the next round, these tentacles and bear claws turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@dice 3d6}) piercing damage and be {@condition restrained} by the tentacles until Initiative count 20 on the next round.

legendaryGroup.name: Zernareth
lairActions: When fighting inside its lair, an aboleth can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the aboleth takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: The aboleth casts {@spell phantasmal force} (no components required) on any number of creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. While maintaining concentration on this effect, the aboleth can't take other lair actions. If a target succeeds on the saving throw or if the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the aboleth's phantasmal force lair action for the next 24 hours, although such a creature can choose to be affected.

Pools of water within 90 feet of the aboleth surge outward in a grasping tide. Any creature on the ground within 20 feet of such a pool must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 20 feet into the water and knocked {@condition prone}. The aboleth can't use this lair action again until it has used a different one.

Water in the aboleth's lair magically becomes a conduit for the creature's rage. The aboleth can target any number of creatures it can see in such water within 90 feet of it. A target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage. The aboleth can't use this lair action again until it has used a different one.

2 ({@dice 1d3}) {@creature Aboleth Spawn|CRCotN|aboleth spawns} emerge from a body of water within 30 feet of the aboleth. They have 46 hit points and take their turn immediately after the aboleth. The aboleth can't use this lair action again until it has used a different one.

regionalEffects: The region containing an aboleth's lair is warped by the creature's presence, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Underground surfaces within 1 mile of the aboleth's lair are slimy and wet and are {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.
Water sources within 1 mile of the lair are supernaturally fouled. Enemies of the aboleth that drink such water vomit it within minutes.

As an action, the aboleth can create an illusory image of itself within 1 mile of the lair. The copy can appear at any location the aboleth has seen before or in any location a creature {@condition charmed} by the aboleth can currently see. Once created, the image lasts for as long as the aboleth maintains concentration, as if concentrating on a spell. Although the image is intangible, it looks, sounds, and can move like the aboleth. The aboleth can sense, speak, and use telepathy from the image's position as if present at that position. If the image takes any damage, it disappears.

regionalEffects: If the aboleth dies, the first two effects fade over the course of {@dice 3d10} days.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Alwin is a 20-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). Alwin has the following Artificer spells prepared:

trait.name: Arcane Jolt
entries: When Alwin hits a target with a magic weapon attack, he can channel magical energy through the strike to create one of the following effects:
The target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} force damage.
One creature or object of Alwins choice that he can see within 30 feet of the target regains {@dice 2d6} hit points.

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: Alwin has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Magic Item Master
entries: Alwin can attune to up to six magic items at once and he gains a +1 bonus all saving throws for each magic item Alwin is attuned to.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Alwin carries a {@item amulet of proof against detection and location}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Alwin makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Big Wrench
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage or 12 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands

action.name: Wrench
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d4 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Humanoid Form Only)
headerEntries: Baldur casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

trait.name: Keen Smell (Bear Form Only)
entries: Baldur has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Baldur uses his Zernareth's Grasp feature, if available. Also, while in Humanoid Form, he also makes two Savage Slash or Wildfire attacks and he can replace one attack with one use of Spellcasting. While in Bear Form, Baldur makes three Bite or Savage Slash attacks.

action.name: Bite (Bear Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Savage Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d10}) acid damage.

action.name: Wildfire (Humanoid Form Only)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Zernareth's Grasp {@recharge 4}
entries: Tendrils of dark energy erupt from a point you can see within 30 feet of you and batter all creatures within 10 feet of that point. Each creature in that area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and can't take reactions until its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage, but suffers no other effect.

bonus.name: Shape Change
entries: Baldur transforms into his bear form or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its speed and amor class, are the same in each form. Baldur reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two Chain attacks.

action.name: Chain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}) if the giant isn't already grappling a creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and has to make a Charisma saving throw (save {@dc 15}). On a failed save, the target is {@condition charmed} by the giant and obeys the giants verbal commands to the best of its abilities. A {@condition charmed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the balor dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 ({@damage 20d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in that area that aren't being worn or carried, and it destroys the balor's weapons.

trait.name: Fire Aura
entries: At the start of each of the balor's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the balor or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The balor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the balor fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The balor makes two attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) force damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) lightning damage. If the balor scores a critical hit, it rolls damage dice three times, instead of twice.

action.name: Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) force damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 25 feet toward the balor.

variant.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
entries: The demon chooses what to summon and attempts a magical summoning.

A balor has a {@chance 50|50 percent|50% summoning chance} chance of summoning {@dice 1d8} {@creature vrock||vrocks}, {@dice 1d6} {@creature hezrou||hezrous}, {@dice 1d4} {@creature glabrezu||glabrezus}, {@dice 1d3} {@creature nalfeshnee||nalfeshnees}, {@dice 1d2} {@creature marilith||mariliths}, or one {@creature goristro}.

A summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 1 minute, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

bonus.name: Teleport
entries: The balor magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The balor makes one Whip attack.

legendary.name: Vile Flames (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The balor summons a vertical column of abyssal fire. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within 60 feet of the balor must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 25 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage and 25 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more, the creature is also {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Creeping Bolt (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: A bolt of lightning arcs from the tip of the balors longsword toward a target that the balor can see within 150 feet of it. Three bolts then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the bolts. A target must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. The target takes 44 ({@damage 10d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a target fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition dazed|XUA2023DruidAndPaladin} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ogre makes one morningstar and one scorching ray attack.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Scorching Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 2} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Hesza makes three Slam or Eldritch Bolt attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Eldritch Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) force damage.

action.name: Plague of Tentacles {@recharge}
entries: Each creature other than a thrall of an aboleth or an aboleth within 10 feet of Hesza must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage and be {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained} by masses of squirming tentacles. The affected creature takes 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage at the start of each of Hesza's turns. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Feed on Weakness
entries: When a creature within 20 feet of Hesza fails a saving throw, she gains 10 temporary hit points.

legendary.name: Slam
entries: Hesza makes one Slam attack.

legendary.name: Eldritch Bolt (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Hesza makes one Eldritch Bolt attack.

legendary.name: Feed (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Each creature {@condition restrained} by Hesza's Plague of Worms takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage, and she gains 6 temporary hit points.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Heavy
entries: The dragon is to heavy to fly properly. If he ends his turn while in the air, he falls instantly to the ground.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 63 ({@damage 18d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or take 15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

fluff.name: Adult Red Dragon

entries: The most covetous of the true dragons, red dragons tirelessly seek to increase their treasure hoards. They are exceptionally vain, even for dragons, and their conceit is reflected in their proud bearing and their disdain for other creatures. The odor of sulfur and pumice surrounds a red dragon, whose swept-back horns and spinal frill define its silhouette. Its beaked snout vents smoke at all times, and its eyes dance with flame when it is angry. Its wings are the longest of any chromatic dragon, and have a blue-black tint along the trailing edge that resembles metal burned blue by fire.

The scales of a red dragon wyrmling are a bright glossy scarlet, turning a dull, deeper red and becoming as thick and strong as metal as the dragon ages. Its pupils also fade as it ages, and the oldest red dragons have eyes that resemble molten lava orbs.

entries.name: Mountain Masters
entries: Red dragons prefer mountainous terrain, badlands, and any other locale where they can perch high and survey their domain. Their preference for mountains brings them into conflict with the hill-dwelling copper dragons from time to time.

entries.name: Arrogant Tyrants
entries: Red dragons fly into destructive rages and act on impulse when angered. They are so ferocious and vengeful that they are regarded as the archetypical evil dragon by many cultures.

No other dragon comes close to the arrogance of the red dragon. These creatures see themselves as kings and emperors, and view the rest of dragonkind as inferior. Believing that they are chosen by Tiamat to rule in her name, red dragons consider the world and every creature in it as theirs to command.

entries.name: Status and Slaves
entries: Red dragons are fiercely territorial and isolationist. However, they yearn to know about events in the wider world, and they make use of lesser creatures as informants, messengers, and spies. They are most interested in news about other red dragons, with which they compete constantly for status.

When it requires servants, a red dragon demands fealty from chaotic evil humanoids. If allegiance isn't forthcoming, it slaughters a tribe's leaders and claims lordship over the survivors. Creatures serving a red dragon live in constant terror of being roasted and eaten for displeasing it. They spend most of their time fawning over the creature in an attempt to stay alive.

entries.name: Obsessive Collectors
entries: Red dragons value wealth above all else, and their treasure hoards are legendary. They covet anything of monetary value, and can often judge the worth of a bauble to within a copper piece at a glance. A red dragon has a special affection for treasure claimed from powerful enemies it has slain, exhibiting that treasure to prove its superiority.

A red dragon knows the value and provenance of every item in its hoard, along with each item's exact location. It might notice the absence of a single coin, igniting its rage as it tracks down and slays the thief without mercy. If the thief can't be found, the dragon goes on a rampage, laying waste to towns and villages in an attempt to sate its wrath.

entries.name: A Red Dragon's Lair
entries: Red dragons lair in high mountains or hills, dwelling in caverns under snow-capped peaks, or within the deep halls of abandoned mines and dwarven strongholds. Caves with volcanic or geothermal activity are the most highly prized red dragon lairs, creating hazards that hinder intruders and letting searing heat and volcanic gases wash over a dragon as it sleeps. With its hoard well protected deep within the lair, a red dragon spends as much of its time outside the mountain as in it. For a red dragon, the great heights of the world are the throne from which it can look out to survey all it controls-and the wider world it seeks to control.
Throughout the lair complex, servants erect monuments to the dragon's power, telling the grim story of its life, the enemies it has slain, and the nations it has conquered.

entries.name: Chromatic Dragons
entries: The black, blue, green, red, and white dragons represent the evil side of dragonkind. Aggressive, gluttonous, and vain, chromatic dragons are dark sages and powerful tyrants feared by all creatures-including each other.

entries.name: Driven by Greed
entries: Chromatic dragons lust after treasure, and this greed colors their every scheme and plot. They believe that the world's wealth belongs to them by right, and a chromatic dragon seizes that wealth without regard for the humanoids and other creatures that have "stolen" it. With its piles of coins, gleaming gems, and magic items, a dragon's hoard is the stuff of legend. However, chromatic dragons have no interest in commerce, amassing wealth for no other reason than to have it.

entries.name: Creatures of Ego
entries: Chromatic dragons are united by their sense of superiority, believing themselves the most powerful and worthy of all mortal creatures. When they interact with other creatures, it is only to further their own interests. They believe in their innate right to rule, and this belief is the cornerstone of every chromatic dragon's personality and worldview. Trying to humble a chromatic dragon is like trying to convince the wind to stop blowing. To these creatures, humanoids are animals, fit to serve as prey or beasts of burden, and wholly unworthy of respect.

entries.name: Dangerous Lairs
entries: A dragon's lair serves as the seat of its power and a vault for its treasure. With its innate toughness and tolerance for severe environmental effects, a dragon selects or builds a lair not for shelter but for defense, favoring multiple entrances and exits, and security for its hoard.

Most chromatic dragon lairs are hidden in dangerous and remote locations to prevent all but the most audacious mortals from reaching them. A black dragon might lair in the heart of a vast swamp, while a red dragon might claim the caldera of an active volcano. In addition to the natural defenses of their lairs, powerful chromatic dragons use magical guardians, traps, and subservient creatures to protect their treasures.

entries.name: Queen of Evil Dragons
entries: Tiamat the Dragon Queen is the chief deity of evil dragonkind. She dwells on Avernus, the first layer of the Nine Hells. As a lesser god, Tiamat has the power to grant spells to her worshipers, though she is loath to share her power. She epitomizes the avarice of evil dragons, believing that the multiverse and all its treasures will one day be hers and hers alone.

Tiamat is a gigantic dragon whose five heads reflect the forms of the chromatic dragons that worship her-black, blue, green, red, and white. She is a terror on the battlefield, capable of annihilating whole armies with her five breath weapons, her formidable spellcasting, and her fearsome claws.

Tiamat's most hated enemy is Bahamut the Platinum Dragon, with whom she shares control of the faith of dragonkind. She also holds a special enmity for Asmodeus, who long ago stripped her of the rule of Avernus and who continues to curb the Dragon Queen's power.

True dragons are winged reptiles of ancient lineage and fearsome power. They are known and feared for their predatory cunning and greed, with the oldest dragons accounted as some of the most powerful creatures in the world. Dragons are also magical creatures whose innate power fuels their dreaded breath weapons and other preternatural abilities.

Many creatures, including wyverns and dragon turtles, have draconic blood. However, true dragons fall into the two broad categories of chromatic and metallic dragons. The black, blue, green, red, and white dragons are selfish, evil, and feared by all. The brass, bronze, copper, gold, and silver dragons are noble, good, and highly respected by the wise.

Though their goals and ideals vary tremendously, all true dragons covet wealth, hoarding mounds of coins and gathering gems, jewels, and magic items. Dragons with large hoards are loath to leave them for long, venturing out of their lairs only to patrol or feed.

True dragons pass through four distinct stages of life, from lowly wyrmlings to ancient dragons, which can live for over a thousand years. In that time, their might can become unrivaled and their hoards can grow beyond price.
Dragon Age Categories

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Magma erupts from a point on the ground the dragon can see within 120 feet of it, creating a 20-foot-high, 5-foot-radius geyser. Each creature in the geyser's area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A tremor shakes the lair in a 60-foot radius around the dragon. Each creature other than the dragon on the ground in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

Volcanic gases form a cloud in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point the dragon can see within 120 feet of it. The sphere spreads a round corners, and its area is lightly obscured. It lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round. Each creature that starts its turn in the cloud must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its turn. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature is {@condition incapacitated}.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region containing a legendary red dragon's lair is warped by the dragon's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Small earthquakes are common within 6 miles of the dragon's lair.
Water sources within 1 mile of the lair are supernaturally warm and tainted by sulfur.
Rocky fissures within 1 mile of the dragon's lair form portals to the Elemental Plane of Fire, allowing creatures of elemental fire into the world to dwell nearby.

entries: If the dragon dies, these effects fade over the course of {@dice 1d10} days.

Kalzifar, also called the rageing wildfire, the lord of flames, or the burned one, is the demon lord of fire and destruction. He appears as a huge dark purple flame with countless still beating hearts burning inside, or sometimes as a huge burn victim still ablaze. His endgoal is to incinerate every living being and claim there hearts as fuel for him.

entries.name: Kalzifar and Imix
entries: Some scholars draw a connection between Kalzifar and Imix, the prince of evil fire. Some theories claim Imix and Kalzifar are just two aspects of the same entity, while others think Imix was spawned by Kalzifar and parted ways with him to set up his own domain. Nobody can say for sure if a connection between them exists however.

entries.name: Kalzifar's Lair
entries: Kalzifar desiganted lair is the vulcano Bergelogne on the 943th layer of the abyss known as the blazing hellscape, an ocean of ash, fire, smoke and vulcanos with a constant smell of sulfur and burning flesh in the air. The air around his layer is incredibly hot and deadly to all without proper protection.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Kalzifar can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects: he can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Up to 3 creature of Kalzifar's Choice within Kalzifar's lair are subjected to the {@spell immolation|XGE} spell (save {@dc 23})
A cloud of black thick smoke forms within a 20-foot radius sphere at a point Kalzifar can see.
Metal objects glow red hot as if they were affected by the {@spell heat metal} spell (save {@dc 23}) within a 10-foot radius sphere at a point within Kalzifar's lair.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region containing Kalzifar's lair is warped by Kalzifar's magic, creating one or more of the following effects:

items: Wildlife periodically bursts into flames.
The air is filled with the stench of sulfur and burning flesh, and vulcanic activity rises in the region.

If a humanoid spends at least 1 hour within 1 mile of the lair, that creature must succeed on a DC 23 Wisdom saving throw or descend into a madness determined by the Madness of Kalzifar table. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw can't be affected by this regional effect again for 24 hours.

entries: If Kalzifar dies, these effects fade over the course of 1d10 days..

entries.name: Madness of Kalzifar
entries: If a creature goes mad in Kalzifar's lair or within line of sight of the demon lord, roll on the Madness of Kalzifar table to determine the nature of the madness, which is a character flaw that lasts until cured. See the Dungeon Master's Guide for more on madness.

entries.caption: Madness of Kalzifar
rows: "I sometimes have the desire to set my self on fire."
"Whatever i do, my suroundings are way to hot."
"Just let me take out your heart real quick."

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Kalzifar fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Kalzifar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Fire Aura
entries: At the start of each of Kalzifar's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 17 ({@dice 5d6}) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches Kalzifar or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 17 ({@dice 5d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Fire Form
entries: Kalzifar can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. He can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing if fire could pass through that space.

trait.name: Abyssal Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If Kalzifar would be reduced to 0 hit points, his current hit point total instead resets to 300 hit points and he regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance and his Rachet Flames reaction recharges. Additionally, Kalzifar's Abyssal Fire bonus action is now always active. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating Kalzifar after his Abyssal Awakening activates.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kalzifar uses his Fireball action or casts a spell, if he can. He then makes three flame lash or hurl flame attacks.

action.name: Flame Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) force damage, plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage. Any creature killed by this attack is drawn into Kalzifar's body, and the corpse is disintegrated after 1 minute. All that remains is a still beating heart that keeps burning in Kalzifar's flames.

action.name: Hurl Flame
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, range 150 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) fire damage.

action.name: Fireball
entries: A dark streak flashes from Kalzifar to a point he chooses within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Rachet Flames {@recharge 5}
entries: As a reaction, when Kalzifar would deal fire damage to a creature immune to fire damage, he can ignore that immunity.

bonus.name: Abyssal Fire {@recharge 4}
entries: As a bonus action, Kalzifar ignores resistance to fire damage until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Kalzifar makes one Flame Lash or Hurl Flame attack.

legendary.name: Heat Wave
entries: Kalzifar creates a blast of heat within 300 feet of himself. Each creature in the area in physical contact with metal objects (for example, carrying metal weapons or wearing metal armor) takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage. Each creature in the area that isn't resistant or immune to fire damage must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

legendary.name: Mind Flare (2 Actions)
entries: Kalzifar floods the mind of a creature he can see within 120 feet of him with visions of infernos and intense flames. The target takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage and must succeed on a {@dc 21} Intelligence saving throw or have its Intelligence score reduced by 2 ({@dice 1d4}).

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Kalzifar's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, +15 to hit with spell attacks). Kalzifar can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or somatic components:

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Lord Alber's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Lord Alber can't be affected or detected by spells of 5th level or lower unless he wishes to be. He has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If Lord Alber fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Fear Aura
entries: Any creature hostile to Lord Alber that starts its turn within 60 feet of him must make a {@dc 26} Wisdom saving throw, unless he is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to Lord Alber's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Lord Alber carries an {@item amulet of draconic superiority|RagingFlames}, a {@item brooch of shielding} and a {@item talisman of ultimate evil|DMG}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Lord Alber makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 20} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) piercing damage, plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 20} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) slashing damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 20} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Lord Alber exhales fire in a 120-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 28} Dexterity saving throw, taking 105 ({@damage 30d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Lord Alber makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: Lord Alber makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Lord Alber beats his wings. Each creature within 20 ft. of him must succeed on a {@dc 28} Dexterity saving throw or take 24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. Lord Alber can then fly up to half his flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Meteor Call (Costs 5 Actions)
entries: Meteor swarm -> Singular Meteor

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Maleeka's innate spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Maleeka is a 15th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). Maleeka has the following Sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Metamagic
entries: Maleeka has 15 sorcery points. She can use only one Metamagic option on a spell when she casts it, unless otherwise noted.

items.name: Heightend Spell.
items.entry: When she casts a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist its effects, she can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw made against the spell.

items.name: Twinned Spell.
items.entry: When she casts a spell that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, she can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).

items.name: Transmuted Spell.
items.entry: When she casts a spell that deals a type of damage from the following list, she can spend 1 sorcery point to change that damage type to one of the other listed types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, thunder.

trait.name: Elemental Affinity
entries: When Maleeka casts a spell that deals fire damage, she can add her Charisma modifier to one damage roll of that spell.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Maleeka carries an {@item iron flask} containing {@creature Maegera the Dawn Titan|SKT}.

bonus.name: Draconic Wings
entries: Maleeka can sprout a pair of dragon wings from her back, gaining a flying speed equal to her current speed. They last until she dismisses them as a bonus action on her turn.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

The fire genasi Maleeka al-Javid has draconic blood running through her veins granting her sorcerous powers. This powers manifest in the form of scales on her hands and arms and draconic looking eyes. She lived most of her live on the elemental plane of fire as a member of sultan Zaros division of the House of Golden Bones. Maleeka only recently came to Toril to help the fire giant Zelsius capture Maegera the Dawn Titan down in Gauntlgrym.

monster.name: Methelgor

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The kraken can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The kraken ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the kraken fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The kraken has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Mythical Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the kraken would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 hit points and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the kraken can now use its Lightning Coat trait during the next hour. Award a party an additional 75,000 XP (150,000 XP total) for defeating the kraken after its Mythical Awakening activates.

trait.name: Lightning Coat (Mythical Awakening Only)
entries: At the start of each of the kraken's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@dice 3d6}) lightning damage A creature that touches the kraken or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@dice 3d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kraken makes three tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d8 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by the kraken, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the kraken, and it takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the kraken's turns. If the kraken takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the kraken. If the kraken dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) lightning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Large or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the kraken is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Lightning Storm
entries: The kraken magically creates three bolts of lightning, each of which can strike a target the kraken can see within 120 feet of it. A target must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a target fails its save by 5 or more and the krakens Mythical Awakening activated within the last hour the target is also {@condition stunned} until the end of the krakens next turn.

legendary.name: Tentacle Attack or Fling
entries: The kraken makes one tentacle attack or uses its Fling.

legendary.name: Barnicle Growth (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Barnicles magically grow on the joints of a creature that the kraken can see within 120 feet of it. The creature must make a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage and its Dexterity score is reduced by 2 ({@dice 1d4}). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and its Dexterity score is not reduced.

legendary.name: Ink Cloud (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: While underwater, the kraken expels an ink cloud in a 60-foot radius. The cloud spreads around corners, and that area is heavily obscured to creatures other than the kraken. Each creature other than the kraken that ends its turn there must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A strong current disperses the cloud, which otherwise disappears at the end of the kraken's next turn.

mythicHeader: If the kraken's Mythical Awakening trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Bite
entries: The kraken makes one bite attack

mythic.name: Lightning Storm (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The kraken uses Lightning Storm.

trait.name: Dire Cacophony
entries: Any creature other than a dire corby that starts its turn within 60 feet of a dire corby and can hear it must make a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is unable to use the Dash action, cannot climb, or cast spells other than cantrips until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The murder has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The murder can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the murder can move through any opening large enough for a dire corby. The murder can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The murder makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target in the murder's space. {@h}42 ({@damage 8d10}) slashing damage, or 21 ({@damage 4d10}) slashing damage if the murder has half of its hit points or fewer.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Olthor is a 4th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: The giant has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Rock Catching
entries: If a rock or similar object is hurled at the giant, the giant can, with a successful {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, catch the missile and take no bludgeoning damage from it.

Olthor is a stone giant druid and member of the circle of swords. He rarely visits the circle, however, spending most of his time in the underdark below the north sword coast. He can act as a guide through the underdark for any friend of the circle.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Reihrehk is an 20th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). They have the following druid spells prepared:

action.name: Change Shape
entries: Reihrehk magically polymorphs into a humanoid, beast or elemental that has a challenge rating equal to or less than their own, or back into their true form. They revert to their true form if they die. Any equipment they are wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (Reihrehk's choice).

In a new form, Reihrehk retains their game statistics and ability to speak, but their AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and they gain any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that they lack.

action.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
entries: Reihrehk touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 ({@dice 4d8 + 2}) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

action.name: Quaterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands, plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Reihrehk has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
entries: Reihrehk's weapon attacks are magical. When Reihrehk hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 4d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

Reihrehk is the acting archdruid of the circle of swords and a deva of Silvanus. However, only Rheidot knows about this. A thousand years ago they were tasked with protecting the Neverwinter Woods. Because of this task Reihrehk founded the circle of swords. In human form, they look like a short old man with long white hair and a full beard. They always lean on a staff made of willow. In deva form, they sprout angelic wings from their back and stand upright without the support of their staff. Due to their angelic nature, Reihrehk hates fiend of any kind and can barely tolerate anyone connected to one. When talking to strangers, They usually asume the role of a senile old fool and when in thoughts, they seem to randomly dose of. They communicate with silvanus in this way.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Rheidot is a 15th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following druid spells prepared:

action.name: Change Shape (2/Day)
entries: Rheidot magically polymorphs into a beast or elemental with a challenge rating of 5 or less, and can remain in this form for up to 7 hours. Rheidot can choose whether his equipment falls to the ground, melds with his new form, or is worn by the new form. Rheidot reverts to his true form if he dies or falls {@condition unconscious}. Rheidot can revert to his true form using a bonus action on his turn.

While in a new form, Rheidot retains his game statistics and ability to speak, but his AC, movement modes, Strength, and Dexterity are replaced by those of the new form, and he gains any special senses, proficiencies, traits, actions, and reactions (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that he lacks. He can cast his spells with verbal or somatic components in his new form.
The new form's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

Eheidot is a druid and high ranking member of the circle of swords. Rheidot has a white beard, is lean and hagrad and wields a {@item staff of the woodlands}. Due to his old age he is exceptionally wise and insightful. Rheidot is almost always chewing on sage leaves. He is known to be kind and friendly in conversations but his friendliness quickly fades when offended. Because the druid lived in the Neverwinter Woods for over 800 years he knows the forest like the back of his hand. Rheidot believes that every living being should be treated with respect and he is always ready to make a sacrifice in order to serve a greater good. Over 800 years ago he was part of an adventuring party to stop the evil archlich Mhecmunas and sacrificed most of his druidic powers to achieve that goal. The lich survived, however, and recently tried to possess Rheidots body to complete his resurrection but his plans where foiled by a party of adventurers. Over the last five years most of his druidic powers returned to him.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Rheidot is carrying a {@item staff of the woodlands}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Rufus' innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Rufus is a 17-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). Rufus has the following Bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Rufus carries the {@item dress of balder|RagingFlames}, a {@item +3 rapier}, a {@item +2 hand crossbow}. a {@item vicious scimitar}, a {@item ring of mind shielding}, a {@item cloak of displacement}, an {@item Ioun Stone, Mastery|DMG|ioun stone of mastery}, a {@item ring of warmth}, an {@item Figurine of Wondrous Power, Obsidian Steed|DMG|obsidian steed} and a {@item deck of many things}. He is attuned to the {@item dress of balder|RagingFlames}, the {@item ring of mind shielding} and the {@item Ioun Stone, Mastery|DMG|ioun stone of mastery}.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Magic can't put Rufus to sleep.

trait.name: Master of Tactics
entries: When Rufus uses the Help action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, the target of that attack can be within 30 feet of Rufus, rather than within 5 feet of him, if the target can see or hear him.

trait.name: Peerless Skill
entries: When Rufus makes an ability check, he can expend one use of Bardic Inspiration, roll the die, and add the number to the check.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Rufus deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 ft. of an ally of Rufus that isn't incapacitated and Rufus doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Rufus makes two attacks. One with his {@item +2 hand crossbow} and one with his {@item vicious shortsword}.

action.name: +2 Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: +3 Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Vicious Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage. When Rufus rolls a 20 with this magic weapon, the target takes an extra 7 slashing damage.

reaction.name: Cutting Words
entries: When a creature that Rufus can see within 60 feet of him makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a damage roll, Rufus can use his reaction to expend one of his uses of Bardic Inspiration, rolling a Bardic Inspiration die and subtracting the number rolled from the creature's roll. The creature is immune if it can't hear Rufus or if it's immune to being {@condition charmed}.

bonus.name: Bardic Inspiration (6/Long Rest)
entries: Rufus chooses one creature other than himself within 60 feet of him who can hear Rufus. That creature gains one Bardic Inspiration die, a {@dice d12}.
Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: Rufus takes the Dash, Disengage, Help or Hide action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: Savalar's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 21}; {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Savalar is a 17th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). Savalar has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Savalar is carrying an {@item emblem of golden bones|WitheringFury}, a {@item robe of the archmagi} and a {@item staff of fire}.

trait.name: Empowered Evocation
entries: Savalar can add his Intelligence modifier to the damage roll of any wizard evocation spell he casts.

trait.name: Sculpt Spells
entries: When Savalar casts an evocation spell that affects other creatures that he can see, he can choose a number of them equal to 1 + the spell's level. The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The Savalar Gadah has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the Savalar Gadah to sleep.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Savalar exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Savalar is the current court wizard of Neverwinter and a trusted advisor to its Lord Protector. Savalars uncontested loyalty, however, lays not by his Lord Protector ,but by his own mother, the ancient obsidian dragon Negil. Secretly he is in fact a high ranking member of the house of golden bones and currently tasked with summoning the demon lord {@creature Kalzifar|RagingFlames} to the Sword Coast.

Although he is an obsidian half-dragon, Savalar uses his innate psionic abilities to disguise himself as a gold half-dragon instead. He always wears a grey {@item robe of the archmagi} and usually leans on a {@item staff of fire}.

Due to Savalars incredibly long life, because of his elven and draconic heritage, and his enormous intellect, he has mastered speaking several exotic languages fluently. On the other hand, Savalar often appears to be arrogant in conversations because of this. He is extraordinarily curious and always strifes to acquire more knowledge.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The demon can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the demon is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the demon instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Soot Body
entries: A creature that touches the demon or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it has to succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The demon makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage, plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Cinder Breath {@recharge 4}
entries: The demon exhales a 30-foot cone of smoldering ash. Each creature in that area must make on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage and is {@condition blinded} until it or a creature within 5 feet of it uses its action to remove the ash from the creatures eyes. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded}.

action.name: Smoke Cloud {@recharge 5}
entries: The demon releases soot and ash into the air within 20 feet of it. The area becomes heavily obscured to any creature that isn't a demon and each creature in that area that isn't a demon must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} and {@condition dazed|XUA2023DruidAndPaladin} for 1 minute, as it starts coughing uncontrollably.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Zelsius is a 17-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). Zelsius has the following Artificer spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Zelsius makes two warhammer attacks.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Flamethrower
entries: Zelsius causes his cannon to exhale fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aboleth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Zernareth's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Mucous Cloud
entries: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by a cloud of sticky mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the end of the aboleth's next turn.

trait.name: Probing Telepathy
entries: If a creature the aboleth can see communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Zernareth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Zernareth makes three attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Arcane Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 14} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) force damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Mind Disrupting Wave {@recharge}
entries: Zernareth unleashs the power of its mind to blast the intellect of each creature of its choice within 30 feet of it, that it can see. Each target must make an {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 49 ({@damage 14d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}. If a target is killed by this damage, its head explodes, assuming it has one.
A {@condition stunned} target can make an Intelligence saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the stunning effect ends.

bonus.name: Enslave {@recharge 4}
entries: The aboleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

The {@condition charmed} target can repeat the saving throw whenever it takes damage, ending the effect on itself on a success. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the aboleth.

bonus.name: Starry Mote (3/Day)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 14} to hit, range 120/120 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d12}) radiant damage.

reaction.name: Maddening Words
entries: When a creature that Zernareth can see within 60 feet of it makes an attack roll against it, Zernareth can use its reaction to subtract 4 ({@dice 1d8}) from the attack roll.

legendary.name: Break Concentration
entries: The aboleth forces a creature, that is concentrating on a spell, it can see within 60 feet of it to make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save the creatures concentration os broken.

legendary.name: Tail Swipe
entries: The aboleth makes one Tail attack.

legendary.name: Psychic Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: One creature {@condition charmed} by the aboleth takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage, and the aboleth regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kenku have longer lifespans than humans. They reach maturity at about 12 years old and can live to 160.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Kenku are chaotic creatures, rarely making enduring commitments, and they care mostly for preserving their own hides. They are generally chaotic neutral in outlook.

entries.name: Size
entries: Kenku have a human-like frame, standing 5–7 feet tall and weigh between 90 and 120 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Expert Forgery
entries: You can duplicate other creatures' handwriting and craftwork. You have advantage on all checks made to produce forgeries or duplicates of existing objects.

entries.name: Flight
entries: You have a flying speed of 50 feet. To use this speed, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Kenku Training
entries: You are proficient in your choice of two of the following skills: {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Deception}, {@skill Stealth}, and {@skill Sleight of Hand}.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries: You can mimic sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check opposed by your Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check.

entries.name: Talons
entries: Your talons are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Auran.
